Post.title: Hello World
Post._content:
Welcome to [Hexo](https://hexo.io/)! This is your very first post. Check [documentation](https://hexo.io/docs/) for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in [troubleshooting](https://hexo.io/docs/troubleshooting.html) or you can ask me on [GitHub](https://github.com/hexojs/hexo/issues).

## Quick Start

### Create a new post

``` bash
$ hexo new "My New Post"
```

More info: [Writing](https://hexo.io/docs/writing.html)

### Run server

``` bash
$ hexo server
```

More info: [Server](https://hexo.io/docs/server.html)

### Generate static files

``` bash
$ hexo generate
```

More info: [Generating](https://hexo.io/docs/generating.html)

### Deploy to remote sites

``` bash
$ hexo deploy
```

More info: [Deployment](https://hexo.io/docs/deployment.html)

title: Hello World
---
Welcome to [Hexo](https://hexo.io/)! This is your very first post. Check [documentation](https://hexo.io/docs/) for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in [troubleshooting](https://hexo.io/docs/troubleshooting.html) or you can ask me on [GitHub](https://github.com/hexojs/hexo/issues).

## Quick Start

### Create a new post

``` bash
$ hexo new "My New Post"
```

More info: [Writing](https://hexo.io/docs/writing.html)

### Run server

``` bash
$ hexo server
```

More info: [Server](https://hexo.io/docs/server.html)

### Generate static files

``` bash
$ hexo generate
```

More info: [Generating](https://hexo.io/docs/generating.html)

### Deploy to remote sites

``` bash
$ hexo deploy
```

More info: [Deployment](https://hexo.io/docs/deployment.html)

Post.title: flutter
Post._content:
## flutter  

flutter windows, mac, linux   .

###  
- windows 7 
- 400mb  disk
- powershell 5.0  / git  

### SDK (https://flutter.io/setup-windows/)
1. SDK  
2.  zip    path 
3.  `flutter`   `flutter_console.bat`  

###   flutter  command
```jshelllanguage
#setup     
flutter doctor
#flutter  
flutter config
```

### 
- flutter   (https://flutter.io/upgrading/)
- flutter path  (   flutter  )
  -   path `flutter\bin;`  
  
## android studio 

IDE vs code, intellij, android studio . (https://flutter.io/get-started/editor/)

android studio, flutter plugin 
- file -> settings -> plugins, search flutter and install (dart plugin  )


##   (android studio)

1. flutter  
![new flutter project](/images/flutter/new_flutter_prj.png "create flutter project")
2. flutter application  
3. flutter sdk path   flutter  
4. finish       .
![main.dart](/images/flutter/created_flutter_app.png "created flutter")

## device  (android studio)

- flutter Android API 16 device .
- tools -> AVD Manager -> Create Virtual Device...
- tools -> SDK Manager ( device api  sdk  .)
-    android studio     .
![virtual device](/images/flutter/virtual_device.png "virtual device")
- command   
  -   : `flutter devices`
  -   : `flutter run`

## flutter package repository
https://pub.dartlang.org/flutter/

## flutter  
- free course : https://www.udacity.com/course/build-native-mobile-apps-with-flutter--ud905

Post.title: passport
Post.content:
passport : http://www.passportjs.org/

Simple, unobtrusive authentication for Node.js

Strategy Package . Local Strategy .

local strategy

.
, .

()

  • req.user :
  • req.login(=logIn) : ( )
  • req.logout : ( )
  • req.isAuthenticated :

Session Storage

  • express session in-memory memory leak (production X)
  • memory leak session-storage (mysql, mongodb, redis )
  • session passport express , passport req.user req.session.passport.user response (store )
  • response session req.logIn serialize

passport

passport id & pwd

user serialize

user deserialize

authentication middleware

login flow

flow

  1. id password post method login url
  2. login router passport.authenticate strategy
  3. strategy id, password (db ), callback passport.authenticate
  4. serialize session user
  5. callback req.logIn
  6. Set-Cookie response
  7. session storage response req.session user storage

code

resource authentication flow

flow

  1. endpont request
  2. cookie session
  3. session deserialize user
  4. req.isAuthenticate
  5. /

code

  • https://github.com/passport/express-4.x-local-example/blob/master/server.js
  • https://scotch.io/tutorials/easy-node-authentication-setup-and-local

Post.title: claudiajs-get-started
Post.content:
claudiajs : https://claudiajs.com

  1. install claudia
  2. execute command npm init
  3. make lambda.js
  4. set aws credential on user root path
  5. create lambda function as command with profile
  6. invoke lambda with profile : claudia test-lambda --profile claudia
  7. update lambda : claudia update
  8. mongodb example project

install claudia

make lambda project

make a lambda.js file : https://docs.aws.amazon.com/lambda/latest/dg/nodejs-prog-model-handler.html

setting AWS IAM

  • https://claudiajs.com/tutorials/installing.html
  • https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sdk-for-javascript/v2/developer-guide/setting-credentials-node.html

make file .aws/credentials

first line is profile name.

create lambda function

seoul region is ap-northeast-2.

invoke lambda

update lambda with npm run command

package.json

update command : npm run deploy

example code

github

Post.title: claudiajs-rest-api
Post._content:
### claudiajs : https://claudiajs.com

1. make project
2. install claudia api module
3. modify package.json script command
4. make api.js file
5. make api gateway
6. example code

### make lambda project

```jshelllanguage
mkdir example
cd example
npm init
```

### install claudia api module : https://claudiajs.com/claudia-api-builder.html

```jshelllanguage
npm install claudia-api-builder -S
```

### modify package.json script command

package.json
```json
...
  "scripts": {
    "start": "claudia create --name rest-api-test --region ap-northeast-2 --api-module api --profile claudia",
    "deploy": "claudia update --profile claudia"
  },
...
```

### make a api.js file : 
- https://github.com/claudiajs/claudia-api-builder/blob/master/docs/api.md#api-definition-syntax
- https://github.com/claudiajs/claudia-api-builder/blob/4f5c30df0365812765806ae2f9fd97e7a1287ed9/docs/api.md

```javascript
var ApiBuilder = require('claudia-api-builder'),
	api = new ApiBuilder(),
	superb = require('superb');

module.exports = api;

api.get('/greet', function (request) {
	return request.queryString.name + ' is ' + superb();
});
```

### make api gateway : https://claudiajs.com/tutorials/hello-world-api-gateway.html

execute command

```jshelllanguage
#claudia create --name [lambda function name, api gateway name] --region [region name] --api-module [main javascript file name] --profile [profile name]
npm run start
```

you can see below console as result

saving configuration
```json
{
  "lambda": {
    "role": "rest-api-test-executor",
    "name": "rest-api-test",
    "region": "ap-northeast-2"
  },
  "api": {
    "id": "XXXXXXXX",
    "module": "api",
    "url": "https://XXXXXXXX.execute-api.ap-northeast-2.amazonaws.com/latest"
  }
}
```

you can connect to `api.url`

### example code

[github](https://github.com/j2yes/lambda-rest-claudia)

###  Reference
-  : https://github.com/bskim/gamingonaws2017_serverless
- setting authorization to call api by aws iam : https://docs.aws.amazon.com/ko_kr/apigateway/latest/developerguide/api-gateway-control-access-using-iam-policies-to-invoke-api.html
Post.raw:

### claudiajs : https://claudiajs.com

1. make project
2. install claudia api module
3. modify package.json script command
4. make api.js file
5. make api gateway
6. example code

### make lambda project

```jshelllanguage
mkdir example
cd example
npm init
```

### install claudia api module : https://claudiajs.com/claudia-api-builder.html

```jshelllanguage
npm install claudia-api-builder -S
```

### modify package.json script command

package.json
```json
...
  "scripts": {
    "start": "claudia create --name rest-api-test --region ap-northeast-2 --api-module api --profile claudia",
    "deploy": "claudia update --profile claudia"
```

### make a api.js file :

```javascript
var ApiBuilder = require('claudia-api-builder'),
	api = new ApiBuilder(),
	superb = require('superb');

module.exports = api;

api.get('/greet', function (request) {
	return request.queryString.name + ' is ' + superb();

```

### make api gateway : https://claudiajs.com/tutorials/hello-world-api-gateway.html

execute command

```jshelllanguage
#claudia create --name [lambda function name, api gateway name] --region [region name] --api-module [main javascript file name] --profile [profile name]
```

```json
    "role": "rest-api-test-executor",
    "name": "rest-api-test",
    "region": "ap-northeast-2"
```

Post.title: ionic-make-android-jar
Post._content:
####   apk  
```
ionic cordova build android --release
```

command    .

```
.
.
.
:transformNative_libsWithMergeJniLibsForRelease
:processReleaseJavaRes UP-TO-DATE
:transformResourcesWithMergeJavaResForRelease
:packageRelease
:assembleRelease
:cdvBuildRelease

BUILD SUCCESSFUL    

Total time: 22.868 secs
Built the following apk(s): 
        /workspace_path/platforms/android/build/outputs/apk/android-release-unsigned.apk

```

#### keystore 
keystore   password ,   . 
    sign key    .
(* keystore    .)
```
keytool -genkey -v -keystore stroke-key.keystore -alias **its_my_sign_key** -keyalg RSA -keysize 2048 -validity 10000
```

#### apk sign
   apk  command sign  (keystore    password )

```
jarsigner -verbose -sigalg SHA1withRSA -digestalg SHA1 -keystore stroke-key.keystore android-release-unsigned.apk **its_my_sign_key**
```

#### apk align 
```
~/Library/Android/sdk/build-tools/25.0.2/zipalign -v 4 /path/android-release-unsigned.apk android-release-aligned.apk
```

***   `android-release-aligned.apk`    .***

    progress bar  ..

   in-app-browser


   .      ,   .
(      .)

#####  

![ ](/images/ionic/deal_list.webp " ")

##### 

![](/images/ionic/p2p_statistics.webp "")

#### api 
node  api  ,    .

     
```sql
CREATE TABLE `p2p`.`deal` (
  `id` INT NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT COMMENT '  ',
  `siteCode` VARCHAR(45) CHARACTER SET 'utf8' NOT NULL,
  `dealCode` VARCHAR(45) CHARACTER SET 'utf8' NOT NULL,
  `dealTitle` VARCHAR(100) CHARACTER SET 'utf8' NOT NULL,
  `dealUrl` VARCHAR(500) CHARACTER SET 'utf8' NOT NULL,
  `dealAmount` INT NOT NULL COMMENT '  ',
  `dealRevenueRate` FLOAT NOT NULL COMMENT ' ',
  `dealMonthPeriod` INT NOT NULL COMMENT '  ( ) ',
  `dealRunoutRate` FLOAT NOT NULL COMMENT '  ',
  `updatedAt` DATETIME NOT NULL DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ON UPDATE CURRENT_TIMESTAMP COMMENT '\n',
  `createdAt` DATETIME NOT NULL DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP COMMENT '\n',
  PRIMARY KEY (`id`));

CREATE TABLE `p2p`.`site` (
  `siteCode` VARCHAR(45) CHARACTER SET 'utf8' NOT NULL COMMENT '  ',
  `siteName` VARCHAR(100) CHARACTER SET 'utf8' NOT NULL COMMENT '  ',
  `siteUrl` VARCHAR(500) CHARACTER SET 'utf8' NOT NULL COMMENT '  ',
  `siteLogo` VARCHAR(500) CHARACTER SET 'utf8' NOT NULL COMMENT '  ',
  PRIMARY KEY (`siteCode`));
```

Post.title: ionic-set-environment
Post._content:
##  document
http://ionicframework.com/docs/intro/installation/

## 
```sbtshell
# permission deny  sudo 
npm install -g ionic cordova
```

***node    .*** 

##   / 

```sbtshell
#
#https://ionicframework.com/getting-started/
ionic start myFirstApp template_name

##template type
#tabs(default) : a simple 3 tab layout
#sidemenu: a layout with a swipable menu on the side
#blank: a bare starter with a single page
#super: starter project with over 14 ready to use page designs
#tutorial: a guided starter project

#  
cd myFirstApp

#(run on browser)
ionic serve
```

> [Error: Cannot find module 'reflect-metadata]  node  6.xx .
> https://github.com/driftyco/ionic/issues/9689 

##   

```sbtshell
#    
cordova platform ls

#  
cordova requirements

#  
cordova platform add ios --save
cordova platform add android --save
```

### ios  

- app store xcode  
- iOS      
```sbtshell
npm install -g ios-sim
npm install -g ios-deploy
```

> [xcode-select: error: tool 'xcodebuild' requires Xcode, but active developer directory '/Library/Developer/CommandLineTools' is a command line tools instance] 
> http://frontend.diffthink.kr/2016/04/ios.html

![ios_setting](/images/ionic/ios_setting.png "ios ")

- xcode preference -> Locations command line tools 
  -  : https://cordova.apache.org/docs/en/latest/guide/platforms/ios/

### android  

android studio  : https://developer.android.com/studio/install.html

ANDROID_HOME path 

```
#mac  
#~.bash_profile  
export ANDROID_HOME="/Users/username/Library/Android/sdk"
export ANDROID_TOOLS="/Users/username/Library/Android/sdk/tools"
export ANDROID_PLATFORM_TOOLS="/Users/username/Library/Android/sdk/platform-tools"
PATH=$PATH:$ANDROID_HOME:$ANDROID_TOOLS:$ANDROID_PLATFORM_TOOLS
```

android   

```
#   
adb devices

# 
# emulator-5554   device

#   
ionic run android --target=emulator-5554
```

> [Error: Could not find gradle wrapper within Android SDK. Might need to update your Android SDK.
> Looked here: /Users/jiseob/Library/Android/sdk/tools/templates/gradle/wrapper]
> https://forum.ionicframework.com/t/error-could-not-find-gradle-wrapper-within-android-sdk-might-need-to-update-yo-ur-android-sdk/22056/15
>      tools 

> [Error: android: Command failed with exit code 2]
>   , 
>  : https://cordova.apache.org/docs/en/latest/guide/platforms/android/

##   ionic command

```
#  
#   (debugging & developer mode  usb   )
#https://developer.android.com/studio/run/device.html#developer-device-options
ionic cordova run android --device
ionic cordova build android --release
ionic cordova platform ls

# browser 
ionic serve 
ionic run browser

##           
#(plaform browser  )
#https://github.com/driftyco/ionic-native/issues/403

#ionic serve runs your app as a website (meaning it doesn't have any Cordova capabilities)
#ionic run browser runs your app in the Cordova browser platform, which will inject cordova.jsand any plugins that have browser capabilities
```
